message:
President Herzog: Iran's attack is like a declaration of war, but we strive for peace.

##
I agree with the first part of the sentence. I even wrote it yesterday 👆 The second part of the sentence, after the Iranian attack experienced by Israel tonight, simply does not fit the Middle East and indicates a lack of understanding of the neighborhood.
This is not the appropriate language, certainly when the entire Middle East is sitting and waiting to see how strong the reaction will be that will land on the enemy.

Weakness invites more attacks. That's how it is in the Middle East. After you react strongly, when the other side is licking its wounds, it's time to announce that you strive for peace. Not before.
For Sale: by original owner in Khan Yunis.

And more of the mockery on social media for the fact that it was just a show:

The Iranian attack was delayed... we agreed on 19:00

To comment, follow this link

Fitzal Al-Kasim, a prominent Syrian journalist (6.5 million followers on Twitter and 12 million followers on Facebook) mocks the Iranian response tonight.
He adds the following quote to Netanyahu's photo:

We filed a complaint with the UN because they (the Iranians - AA) left us awake for nothing.

To comment, follow this link

The swarm of Gazans who arrived this morning at the coastal axis on A-Rashid Street in the western Gaza Strip, when a rumor spread that the IDF might be allowing them to move to the northern Gaza Strip (a rumor that later turned out to be false - AA)

To comment, follow this link

Sources identified with the Shiite axis analyze satellite images and point to the damage they claim was caused to the runway at the Nabatim base as a result of the Iranian attack.

To comment, follow this link

IDF spokesperson: IDF forces built an engineering bridge over Wadi Gaza (south of Gaza City in the central region of the Gaza Strip) to allow vehicles to cross from north to south and back.

To comment, follow this link

This is what a Shahad 136 UAV looks like

To comment, follow this link

The IDF spokesman publishes documentation from the successful interception of dozens of UAVs and cruise missiles from Iran.

The interceptions in the video were carried out using fighter jets. In the documentation it is possible to distinguish the unique shape of the Iranian UAV - Shahad 136.

To comment, follow this link

Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:
Jahad Abu Mehdi, born in 1969, resident of the village of Khiam.

He was killed in an IDF attack this morning in Khiam in southern Lebanon 👆

Number 276

To comment, follow this link

In many publications it is claimed that this is an Iranian drone that got stuck on the way to Israel.
This is not true. Fake news.

Here is this video published on 29.2
👇👇:

 https://twitter.com/shahokurdy/status/1763263017578352959?t=HvaWoIryCw5WAQ6m4ZprKA&s=19

To comment, follow this link

France advised its citizens to leave Iran immediately.

To comment, follow this link

One of the missiles launched yesterday by the Iranian Revolutionary Guards toward Israel landed in the village of Kohrama in the Shiraz district of Iran and completely destroyed one of the houses in the village.

To comment, follow this link

Iranian Foreign Minister: We informed the neighboring countries about the attack against Israel 72 hours before it happened.

To comment, follow this link

Perhaps something like this...

To comment, follow this link

Why don't the Israeli officials play tricks on the Iranians like the Iranian officials did before the attack?
How about something that will put all the Iranian Revolutionary Guards under stress?
Some elaborate videos, hints with maps... photographs of types of missiles...
We don't have to stay in the mindset of the past wars. The waiting position that Iran is in now is an opportunity for Israel.

To comment, follow this link

IDF: A short while ago, in response to the launches that were fired toward northern Israel overnight, IDF fighter jets struck a significant Hezbollah weapons manufacturing site in the area of Nabi Chit, deep inside Lebanon. 

Attached is a video of the strike: https://bit.ly/4aFcEwI

Channels affiliated with the Iranian opposition:
Graffiti on a wall in Tehran:
Hit them, Israel
Iranians are behind you

To comment, follow this link

An Iranian missile found this morning in Damascus province in Syria. Apparently the Hurmashhar type missile.

To comment, follow this link

Iran:
All flights at the airports in Tehran, Bushehr, Esfahan, Shiraz and the west of the country have been suspended until tomorrow at six in the morning.

To comment, follow this link

The Iranian currency changes prefix and reaches a new low and the Iranian stock market in the red

The morning after the Iranian attack, the Iranian currency traded at a rate of 700,000 Rials to one US dollar.
Only less than a month ago, the currency traded at a rate of about 580 thousand riyals to the US dollar, which reflects a decrease of about 20 percent in one month in the value of the currency.

To comment, follow this link

Gaza channels claim that there are 5 Palestinian deaths from IDF fire following the attempts of IDF soldiers to prevent the population from moving to the north of the Gaza Strip.

To comment, follow this link

Despite what the IDF spokesperson says, Palestinian sources insist that at least 200 people managed to get from the south of the Gaza Strip to the north last night.

To comment, follow this link

Gaza Strip: One of the attacks on the coastal road (A-Rashid Street) in order to drive away the Palestinians who tried to reach the northern part of the Strip.
The Palestinians report a number of wounded.

To comment, follow this link

The IDF spokesperson's response:

Further to the reports that the IDF forces allow the return of residents to the north of the Gaza Strip, these are false reports. The IDF will not allow the return of residents either through the Salah Al-Din axis or through the Rashid axis (the coast). The northern area of the Gaza Strip is still a combat zone and it will not be possible to return to it at all.

Further to this, the Palestinians report attacks by Israeli aircraft on the coastal axis - A-Rashid Street in order to prevent Gaza residents from reaching the north of the Strip.

To comment, follow this link

Palestinian channels: Palestinian displaced persons are returning to the north of the Gaza Strip for the first time since the beginning of the war
IDF spokesman: This is a fake

Palestinian channels report that the IDF forces are allowing Palestinian women and young people up to the age of 14 to return to the north of the Gaza Strip via the coastal road (A-Rashid Street).

According to the reports, hundreds of the displaced people left Rafah and the center of the Gaza Strip and reached the north of the Gaza Strip.

The Palestinians report that there is no official announcement from Israel on the subject, but this is actually happening.
Palestinian journalists estimate that Israel may be trying to thin out the size of the population in Rafah with this step in preparation for possible action after efforts to reach a deal with Hamas failed.

To comment, follow this link

Hamas-identified channels publish a letter of condolence sent by Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip, on April 11 to Ismail Haniyeh, chairman of the political bureau of Hamas, following the assassination of the latter's 3 sons.
Sinwar sent the letter of condolences in his name and in the name of Muhammad Deif, in the name of the operatives of the military wing of Hamas and in the name of the residents of the Gaza Strip.

To comment, follow this link

Additional documentation of the attack in the last hour in the Nabi Shayth area in the depths of Lebanon.
According to Lebanese media, there were no casualties in the attack. The attacked building was empty.

To comment, follow this link

Iranian missiles that fell tonight in Rawandez, Kurdistan region in Iraq, very close to the border with Iran.

To comment, follow this link

Iranian sources: We managed to hit two Israeli bases as part of the attack - Nabatim base and Ramon base.
According to them, there are squadrons of F-35 aircraft at the Nabatim base and at the Ramon base there are squadrons of F-16s.

To comment, follow this link

Lebanese sources: This is the damage caused in the village of Khiam in southern Lebanon as a result of an IDF attack on the site early in the morning.
As a result of this attack, one Lebanese was killed and others were injured.

To comment, follow this link

Documentation from the area that was attacked a short time ago deep in Lebanon - the Beqaa area.

To comment, follow this link

Palestinian channels report that for the first time since the beginning of the war, a number of bakeries in Gaza City have reopened - this morning there were long lines there.

To comment, follow this link

Lebanese media reports on an Israeli attack deep in Lebanon in the area of Saraaine - Nabi Shayth in Beqaa.

To comment, follow this link

Foreign Minister Israel Katz in this morning's interview with the IDF radio:
"We said that if Iran attacks Israel, Israel will attack Iran - that is still in effect."

To comment, follow this link

The fact that almost no damage was caused as a result of the extensive Iranian attack that benefited from aggressive Iranian "marketing efforts", serves as fertile ground for conspiracy theories on social networks according to which everything was a planned show coordinated in advance between the US, Iran and Israel...

To comment, follow this link

As you can see, the Iranians are busy this morning with intensive threat maintenance and also with announcing new equations - a favorite part of the Iranian axis:
The axis of equations...

To comment, follow this link

Mohammad Kalibaf, Speaker of the Iranian Parliament:
The blow we inflicted on the Zionist entity was strong and beneficial. It made the Zionist entity repent!  (Using the words of the Supreme Leader of Iran before the attack-AA).
We will respond strongly to any threat from Israel or its supporters from any country.

To comment, follow this link

Commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, Hossein Salami:
We established a new equation with Israel and opened a new page in the confrontation with it.
We will attack any place that will be used by Israel to attack our interests.

To comment, follow this link

The Iranian Chief of Staff directs threats to Israel and the US:

Our attack is over. It achieved its goals.
If Israel responds we will attack much more widely.
If the US participates in the attack, we will attack its bases in the region.

To comment, follow this link

In the Iranian parliament, the launches towards Israel and the "successful revenge" were celebrated with chants:
Death to America
Death to Israel

To comment, follow this link

The airspaces of Jordan, Lebanon and Iraq were opened.

To comment, follow this link

Those who were the most satisfied tonight are the Gazans:
Tonight, for the first time after 190 nights, we were able to sleep peacefully without the hum of the Israeli drones.

To comment, follow this link

The Lebanese report that the IDF attacked this morning in the Tafah region of southern Lebanon.

According to the IDF spokesperson, a base of the Radwan force, the elite force of Hezbollah, was attacked.

To comment, follow this link

Residents in the village of Almania in northern Lebanon (north of Tripoli) recorded two interceptions tonight that look different from the types of interceptions they have seen until now.

To comment, follow this link

A lot of hatred on social media towards the Jordanian regime due to its prominent part in the interception of the missiles that were launched into Israel.
Beyond the fire on social networks, Iranian missiles landed in Jordanian territory. In the A-Ramatha area a (real) fire broke out.

To comment, follow this link

More Iranian missiles landed in the territory of Erbil in Iraq.

To comment, follow this link

Some of the Iranian missiles fell on the territory of Baghdad, which did not stop the Iraqis from celebrating👆

To comment, follow this link

Iraq: Iran's supporters in Karbala and Baghdad went out to celebrate the "great victory" tonight.

To comment, follow this link

As part of the threats and the attempt to establish a new Iranian deterrence equation against Israel, the Iranians hung the attached poster in Palestine Square in Tehran:

"Your next mistake will be the end of your counterfeit state"

To comment, follow this link

The Iranian Defense Minister published this photo early in the morning with a finger on southern Israel.

The Iranians officially claimed that they hit the Israeli air force base in Nevatim, from where they claim the planes that attacked the consulate in Damascus took off.

As far as the Iranians are concerned, the attack they named "The Real Promise" was hailed as a victory - the target was hit.
The Iranians, for their part, came for their satisfaction. They showed that they have the courage to attack, and this, according them, abided by international law. They present it as an act of defense and not an attack.
Now they are busy dispersing threats if Israel dares to strike back.

They are establishing deterrence against Israel in the future so that it will no longer dare to eliminate senior Iranian officials.
They are trying to establish an equation (as they like in the Shiite axis), so that there will be a known and recognized price for Israel based on an existing action as was the case tonight.

The big night of interceptions

According to the New York Times, the Iranian attack on Israel tonight included the launch of:
185 UAVs
36 cruise missiles
110 surface-to-surface missiles

According to Israeli sources, about 99% of what was launched towards Israel was intercepted, using the Israeli air defense systems as well as the air defense systems of Israel's allies led by the USA.

According to the IDF spokesperson, most of the targets were intercepted outside the territory of the State of Israel.
The IDF spokesperson announced that a number of hits were detected at a military base in the south of the country, where there was minor damage to the infrastructure.

To comment, follow this link
To comment, follow this link

Negev, southern Israel: Israeli media report that a 10-year-old girl was rushed in serious condition to a hospital in Be'er Sheva after sustaining injuries to the head as a result of missile shrapnel.

To comment, follow this link

Jerusalem: Interceptions over the Temple Mount.

To comment, follow this link

Jordan: a large metal object reportedly fell in the residential neighborhood of Marj al-Hammam in the Jordanian capital of Amman.

To comment, follow this link

The Iranian Tasnim news agency, a short time ago: Iranian citizens celebrate the launch of missiles towards Israel.

To comment, follow this link

Sources associated with the Syrian opposition report an Israeli attack on Damascus Airport, moments ago.

To comment, follow this link

Additional Palestinian documentation of interceptions over the skies of Israel, this time from the West Bank city of Nablus.

To comment, follow this link

Interceptions over the skies of Jenin in the West Bank, moments ago.

To comment, follow this link

Sirens heard in Jerusalem, Samaria, the Negev and the Golan

To comment, follow this link

👆 It can be assumed that the Iranian report on the launch of ballistic missiles was false.

To comment, follow this link

The Iranian delegation to the UN: The response to the attack on our consulate in Damascus is over. If Israel commits a stupid act, we will respond with greater force.

To comment, follow this link

The Minister of Foreign Affairs of the European Union: We strongly condemn the unprecedented Iranian attack on Israel.

To comment, follow this link

IDF spokesperson:

Based on the situation assessment, residents of the northern Golan Heights, the Nevatim area, Dimona, and Eilat are advised to remain near a designated shelter until further notice.

Upon receiving the proper warning, individuals should seek shelter. If no such area is available, follow the guidelines that are attached below.

Regardless, one should wait a minimum of 10 minutes before leaving shelter. 

It's important to stay informed by monitoring media messages and to await additional instructions. 

For detailed instructions, please refer to: https://www.oref.org.il/12767-en/Pakar.aspx

To comment, follow this link

Iran: (organized) celebrations in Tehran following the news of the attack on Israel.

To comment, follow this link

Missiles flying over Iraq en route to Israel, according to Iraqi sources.

To comment, follow this link

Hezbollah: At 00:35 (local time), we launched dozens of rockets at the Israeli Qela air defense base in the Golan Heights.

To comment, follow this link

Al-Jazeera, citing Iranian media ("from knowledgeable sources"):
A wave of ballistic missiles has just been launched at Israel.

To comment, follow this link

The British Prime Minister strongly condemns the Iranian attack on Israel and announces: We will continue to protect Israel's security.

The French foreign minister also condemns the Iranian attack.

To comment, follow this link

Western countries are openly and unreservedly standing by Israel's side against Iran.

To comment, follow this link

Al Arabiya Network: British fighter jets took off from Cyprus to participate in the interception of the UAVs.

To comment, follow this link

Sources identified with the Shia axis:

Iranian drones have reached the skies of Damascus.

The airport in Beirut is closed.

To comment, follow this link

Sources associated with the Shiite axis claim that the Iranian attack consists of three phases:
1. Launching the UAVs from Iran.
2. Launching of drones and missiles from the axis countries: Syria, Lebanon and Iraq to make it difficult for the Israeli air defense systems.
3. Launching cruise missiles and ballistic missiles.

To comment, follow this link

Reuters: The Jordanian air defense systems are preparing to intercept the UAVs.

To comment, follow this link

The skies of Iraq: it can be seen with certainty that this is a Shahad 136 type UAV.

To comment, follow this link

The Iranian Revolutionary Guards: the response includes dozens of drones and missiles.

To comment, follow this link

Iranian television officially confirms: the Iranian Revolutionary Guards have launched a large-scale UAV attack against targets in Israeli territory.

##
To me this is tantamount to a declaration of war.
Israel should respond accordingly.

To comment, follow this link

The Iraqi Minister of Transportation announced that Iraqi airspace is closed to flights.

To comment, follow this link

Sources identified with the Shiite axis: Shahad 136 UAVs were launched from Iran towards Israel

To comment, follow this link

The supreme leader of Iran on Twitter: the evil regime will be punished

To comment, follow this link

IDF spokesperson: UAVs were launched from Iran towards Israel. They take a few hours to arrive.

To comment, follow this link

Question: Are the Israeli missiles already on their way to Tehran?

If we know that an attack has begun against us, we don't have to wait until the drones hit Israeli territory to react....

To comment, follow this link

Arab reports that some of the Iranian drones crashed in Iraqi territory.

The Iranian Defense Minister: Any country that opens its airspace to an attack against Iran will receive a response.

Egypt has also closed its airspace now.

To comment, follow this link

Unofficial Iranian sources affiliated with the Iranian Revolutionary Guards: About 50 drones were launched from Iranian territory towards Israel.

Sources associated with the Shiite axis claim that the noise of the drone engines launched towards Israel was heard in the skies over Iraq and in western Iran.

To comment, follow this link

Lebanese media: a series of 7 Israeli attacks in the last few minutes in the area of Al-Khiyam, Rachaya Al Foukhar and Hasbaiyya in southern Lebanon.

To comment, follow this link

If I were the Minister of Defense, I would launch an attack to kill Iranian officers in Damascus right now... there is no better time than this.
Already included in the response.

To comment, follow this link

The Palestinians reported attacks in the "belt of fire" outline in the north of the Nuseirat refugee camp in the center of the Gaza Strip.

To comment, follow this link

The Jordanian Aviation Authority:
Jordan's airspace will be closed to aircraft traffic, temporarily, starting tonight.

Jordanian Aviation Authority in a follow-up message: The closure of Jordanian airspace will last several hours. Another decision regarding the renewal of the closure will take place according to developments.

To comment, follow this link

Hamas in an official announcement:

"A short time ago we gave the answer to the offer we received last Monday to the brokers in Qatar and Egypt.
Hamas once again emphasizes its adherence to its demands and the demands of the Palestinian people:
A permanent ceasefire, the withdrawal of the occupying forces from all over the Gaza Strip, the return of the displaced to their homes, an increase in aid income and the beginning of the rehabilitation of the Gaza Strip.

We also emphasize that we are ready for a serious and genuine prisoner exchange deal between the parties."

To comment, follow this link

IDF Spokesperson: Following a situational assessment, it was determined that as of 23:00 Israel time tonight (Sunday), changes will be made to the Home Front Command’s defensive guidelines.

As part of the changes, it was decided to prohibit educational activities across Israel. In green areas, gatherings will be limited to 1,000 people. 

Attached is the Home Front Command's defensive guidelines: https://idfanc.activetrail.biz/ANC1304245066

The instructions published on the official Home Front Command channels must be adhered to and followed. The full instructions are updated on the National Emergency Portal and the Home Front Command app.

To comment, follow this link

USA: President Biden cut his vacation short due to the situation in the Middle East.

The White House: Iran should immediately release the MSC Aries ship it seized in international waters. We condemn the takeover.

To comment, follow this link

IDF Spokesperson: Over the last few hours, confrontations between Israeli civilians and Palestinians took place in several locations in the area of Judea and Samaria, during which rocks were hurled and shots were fired. Dozens of Israelis and Palestinians were injured to different degrees. 

Numerous IDF and Israel Border Police forces were positioned in the area and the forces deployed riot dispersal means. As of now, all of the incidents have concluded.

In addition to the forces currently stationed in Judea and Samaria, it was decided to reinforce the area with several IDF companies and additional Israel Border Police forces. 

Security forces are continuing to pursue the terrorists who murdered Israeli civilian Binyamin Achimair.

To comment, follow this link

Documenting the moments of the assassination 👆 of Muhammad Rasul Dagharmeh, the commander of the military wing of Hamas in Tubas, yesterday.

His vehicle was blocked by the Israeli jeeps and he was shot to death even before the doors of the jeeps opened.

To comment, follow this link

IDF Spokesperson: As a result of the explosive UAV attack in the area of Hanita earlier today (Saturday), an IDF reservist who is a member of the kibbutz security team was severely wounded. He was evacuated to the hospital to receive medical treatment and his family has been informed.

To comment, follow this link

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza:
 
52 dead in the Strip in the last day.
89 deaths in the day preceding it.

33,686 dead and about 76,300 wounded since the beginning of the war.

To comment, follow this link

The funeral of Jahad Abu al-Aliya in the village of Al-Ma'ir in the Ramallah district (killed yesterday during the clashes that developed during the search for the boy Binyamin Achimair).
The participants in the funeral chant:

We are your people, Ya Sinwar!
Ya Gada, come on and start a revolution... that's what (Saleh) Al-Arouri ordered!

To comment, follow this link

Amidst ongoing tensions with Israel, leading to the closure of Western embassies in Iran and the cancellation of flight routes between Western countries and Iran, the Iranian stock market is in the red today.

Simultaneously, the Iranian currency has hit a new all-time low, with the exchange rate reaching 660 thousand rials to one US dollar.

To comment, follow this link

Gaza Strip

The IDF attacked the Harzallah building in Nuseirat in the center of the Gaza Strip

To comment, follow this link

14-year-old Israeli teen kidnapped and murdered, clashes break out in nearby Palestinian villages

Today, the body of 14-year-old Israeli teen Benyamin Achimeir was found, showing signs of violence. He had been reported missing a couple of days ago, prompting search efforts.

IDF and Shin Bet personnel have informed Israeli media that the teen was murdered, and they are currently searching for the suspects.

Clashes have reportedly broken out between Israelis and Palestinians near the villages of Duma and Mughayir, following the news of the murder. 

In an official proclamation, Hamas called on the residents of the West Bank to come out and confront IDF forces and settlers in the West Bank against the background of the "riots in Duma and Mughayir."

To comment, follow this link

AP reports that "Iranian commando forces accompanied by a helicopter" took control of a ship in the Straits of Hormuz, dozens of kilometers from the Emirati sea port of Fujairah.

The ship in question is the MSC Aries, which flies the Portuguese flag, and is reportedly linked to the Zodiac company, which is partially owned by Israeli businessman Eyal Ofer.

In the past, Iran seized oil tankers on the grounds that the oil in them was illegally smuggled and was Iranian oil.
This time, Iranian forces took over a container ship. Blatant piracy for all intents and purposes.

To comment, follow this link

Australia: 5 dead and several seriously injured in a stabbing attack in a mall in Sydney.
A local policewoman shot and killed the terrorist.

To comment, follow this link

Reuters reports:

The Netherlands has closed its embassy in Tehran for the next day.

The Australian airline suspended its flights to Tehran until Thursday.

To comment, follow this link

First record of the Iranian reaction...(:

On social networks, they are having fun at the expense of the Iranians: one wrote the Iranian reaction is like the "disappearing imam" (the Shia version of the messiah) - we don't know when it will appear...

To comment, follow this link

The tweet of the Iranian member of parliament, Javad Karimi Ghodousi, who hinted yesterday 👆 about an Iranian attack within hours, has so far received almost a million views.
Ghodousi has only 13 thousand followers.
His most popular tweet so far... But he is currently not delivering the goods...

To comment, follow this link

Lebanon: The threats 👆 against the Syrian refugees in the Christian villages in East Beirut took their toll - they started to leave.

To comment, follow this link

Gaza Strip

IDF Spokesperson: IDF fighter jets struck and destroyed three launchers containing 20 rockets that were ready to fire toward central Israel.

To comment, follow this link

Lebanese channels reported this morning around 06:30 on 5 attacks by the IDF in the Rihan area in southern Lebanon.

The IDF spokesperson confirms: a large Hezbollah base was attacked there.

To comment, follow this link

President Biden was asked tonight by reporters: What is your message to Iran at this moment?
Biden answers: Don't
Biden leaves the podium... then returns to the encore:
We are devoted to the defense of Israel, we will support it, we will help defend it and Iran will not succeed.
